channel.title: Comments on: Download file concurrently in Golang – Part 4(Resume)

item.title: By: Sugeng
item.dc:creator: Sugeng
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/download-file-concurrently-in-golang-part-4-resume/comment-page-1/#comment-4">Akshay Khairmode</a>.
Hi Akshay,
Mainly I just want to learn it, I'll try to code it myself, but it's good to have some references. Of course, I will reference this article if I publish my code :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Akshay Khairmode.

Hi Akshay,

Mainly I just want to learn it, I’ll try to code it myself, but it’s good to have some references. Of course, I will reference this article if I publish my code ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Akshay Khairmode
item.dc:creator: Akshay Khairmode
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/download-file-concurrently-in-golang-part-4-resume/comment-page-1/#comment-3">Sugeng</a>.
Hi Sugeng,
Thanks for the feedback. Let me know if anything can be improved.
If your project is academic I would suggest you code it yourself so you learn better, If you are working on some production applications then please use the code at your own risk.
If it's for a personal project feel free to use it. Anyways a credit would be appreciated.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sugeng.

Hi Sugeng,

Thanks for the feedback. Let me know if anything can be improved.

If your project is academic I would suggest you code it yourself so you learn better, If you are working on some production applications then please use the code at your own risk.

If it’s for a personal project feel free to use it. Anyways a credit would be appreciated.

item.title: By: Sugeng
item.dc:creator: Sugeng
item.description: I really enjoy this tutorial series, really help me understand golang. Can I use your code for my project?
item.content:encoded: I really enjoy this tutorial series, really help me understand golang. Can I use your code for my project?
